topic.title: Using the Jira API and the AI Positron Assistant for Automating Tasks

section.title: What is Jira?
section.p: Jira, developed by Atlassian, is a project management tool designed to help teams with planning projects, tracking issues, release management, and more.

section.title: Jira API
section.p: Jira provides API support for custom workflows and other customizations for both on-premise and cloud applications. This topic describes the process of documenting a given issue using the AI Positron Assistant add-on.

p.note: This document demonstrates using a simple API call, without generating an API key, while mainly using the browser to return the information about the issue. A curl request (or even a dedicated application like Postman) can also be used, but authorization might not work without generating an API key or setting up a custom authorization method.

section.p: The main API call for this example will have this structure:https://<site-url>/rest/api/<version-id>/<resource-name>

For the version-id, this example uses the API's second version. There is also a third version of the API that currently is in beta, but many on-premise Jira solutions might have not yet been configured to use it.

ol.li: Access Jira and log in using the browser of your choice.
Format the URL to use the API using the structure mentioned above:https://johndoe.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/SCRUM-2401
Access the constructed API URL using your browser.

section.title: Creating a DITA Topic Based on a Jira Issue
section.p: The AI Positron Assistant add-on can be used to programmatically create documentation drafts. This feature can be used to create a documentation topic about a given Jira issue.

ol.li: Make sure the content provided by the API is saved.

Construct a prompt for the AI to give it instructions about what to do with the data. For example:Write a DITA topic that documents the Jira issue and save it in the current project. Use the Jira issue id as the name of the document. The JIRA issue number is: SCRUM-2401

Enter the constructed prompt in the AI Positron Assistant's chat.Depending on your desired goal, the AI Positron Assistant may require context retrieval. Also, to save the new document, the AI Positron Assistant will request permission.

section.p: Result: A DITA topic should have been created based on the instructions and information retrieved from the Jira issue.
